addon_info.name: Blaze Controls
addon_info.author: Cr8-xyz <thamsanqa.dev@gmail.com>
addon_info.description: Animation, viewport, and navigation controls for AI agents

ai_integration.agent_description:
This addon provides comprehensive scene manipulation and viewport control capabilities for AI agents. It handles animation playback, timeline navigation, viewport shading modes, and 3D navigation controls. All controls are designed to work seamlessly with Blender's interface and provide immediate visual feedback.

The controls are organized into three main categories: Animation controls for timeline manipulation, Viewport controls for display modes, and Navigation controls for 3D view manipulation.

tools.name: frame_jump_start
tools.usage: Use to quickly go to the beginning of the animation timeline

tools.name: frame_jump_end
tools.usage: Use to quickly go to the end of the animation timeline

tools.name: keyframe_jump_prev
tools.usage: Use to navigate to the previous keyframe in the timeline

tools.name: keyframe_jump_next
tools.usage: Use to navigate to the next keyframe in the timeline

tools.name: animation_play
tools.usage: Use to start playing the animation from current frame

tools.name: animation_pause
tools.usage: Use to stop animation playback

tools.name: animation_play_reverse
tools.usage: Use to play animation backwards from current frame

tools.name: viewport_set_solid
tools.usage: Use to change viewport display mode to solid shading

tools.name: viewport_set_rendered
tools.usage: Use to change viewport display mode to rendered shading

tools.name: get_viewport_screenshot
tools.description: Capture a screenshot of the current 3D viewport and return the image for visual analysis
tools.usage: Use to capture and immediately see the current viewport state. Returns both file info and image data for B.L.A.Z.E to analyze visually.

parameters.name: max_size
parameters.description: Maximum size in pixels for the largest dimension of the image

parameters.name: filepath
parameters.description: Path where to save the screenshot file (required)

examples: take a screenshot and show me what it looks like
capture viewport so I can see the current scene
let me see what the viewport looks like right now

tools.name: orbit_left
tools.description: Orbit the viewport view to the left
tools.usage: Use to rotate the 3D view around the scene to the left

tools.name: orbit_right
tools.description: Orbit the viewport view to the right
tools.usage: Use to rotate the 3D view around the scene to the right

tools.name: orbit_up
tools.usage: Use to rotate the 3D view around the scene upward

tools.name: orbit_down
tools.usage: Use to rotate the 3D view around the scene downward

tools.name: pan_left
tools.description: Pan the viewport view to the left
tools.usage: Use to move the 3D view left without rotating

tools.name: pan_right
tools.description: Pan the viewport view to the right
tools.usage: Use to move the 3D view right without rotating

tools.name: pan_up_forward
tools.description: Pan the viewport view up or forward
tools.usage: Use to move the 3D view up or forward without rotating

tools.name: pan_down_backward
tools.description: Pan the viewport view down or backward
tools.usage: Use to move the 3D view down or backward without rotating

tools.name: zoom_in
tools.usage: Use to get a closer view of the scene

tools.name: zoom_out
tools.usage: Use to get a wider view of the scene

context_hints: Controls are organized into Animation, Viewport, and Navigation categories
All controls provide immediate visual feedback in the Blender viewport
Navigation controls work with any 3D view, animation controls affect the timeline
Viewport controls change how the scene is displayed without affecting the scene data
